clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of High Resolution-Computed Tomography (CT) in Tuberculosis (TB) Outbreak Investigation
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Addition of High Resolution-CT in Outbreak Investigation of Tuberculosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Armed Forces Capital Hospital, Republic of Korea

clinical_study.source: Armed Forces Capital Hospital, Republic of Korea

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the role of high-resolution computed tomography of the chest (HRCT) in the investigation of an outbreak of TB that developed in the South Korean army.

detailed_description.textblock: Outbreak investigation including tuberculin skin test (TST), QuantiFERONÂ® TB Gold In-Tube (QFT), and simple chest radiography (CXR) will be performed. For participants with any abnormal findings in these tests, HRCT will be carried out. Active pulmonary TB is diagnosed based on sputum studies or HRCT findings. In addition, participants with positive results both in TST and QTF will be treated as having a latent TB infection (LTBI). TST and QTF were repeated in participants with positive result in one of these tests. CXR will be repeated in all participants at 3 and 6 months of follow-up.

study_pop.textblock: A military unit in South Korean Army

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All soldiers who assigned to the military battery where a tuberculosis outbreak occurred
Exclusion Criteria:
- Soldiers who could not complete study

responsible_party.name_title: Sei Won Lee/Division chief of pulmonology
